title: Webb identifies earliest supernova to date
summary: The NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope has confirmed the source of a super-bright flash of light known as a gamma-ray burst, generated by an exploding massive star when the Universe was only 730 million years old. For the first time for such a remote event, the telescope provided a detection of the supernova’s host galaxy. Webb’s quick-turnaround observations verified data taken by telescopes around the world that had been following the gamma-ray burst since it onset, which occurred in mid-March.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch classified payload for the National Reconnaissance Office
summary: The mission, dubbed NROL-77, is likely to be the final time SpaceX uses Landing Zone 2 to recover a first stage Falcon booster. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 2:16 p.m. EST (1916 UTC).

title: LeoLabs lands interagency contract to feed TraCSS and track adversarial spacecraft
summary:
LeoLabs has won an interagency contract to provide space-surveillance data for the U.S. government, supporting adversarial spacecraft monitoring and the TraCSS orbital traffic coordination platform due to enter full service early next year.

title: America must stop treating China’s lunar plans as a footrace
summary:

title: Soyuz safely lands in Kazakhstan
summary: A NASA astronaut and two cosmonaut crewmates strapped into their Soyuz ferry ship Monday evening, undocked from the International Space Station and plunged to an on-target landing on the frigid steppe of Kazakhstan early Tuesday to wrap up an eight-month mission.

title: Finland’s ICEYE Closes €150 Million Series E Funding Round
summary:
Finnish Earth observation data provider and Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellite manufacturer ICEYE has closed a new funding round, securing €150 million. Founded in 2014, ICEYE operates the world’s largest SAR satellite constellation, providing near-real-time insights day or night and in all weather conditions. It manufactures its satellites in-house, delivering spacecraft for its own Earth […]
